Conference Venue

The ACM SIGGRAPH VRCAI 2025 conference will be held at the Macau University of Science and Technology (MUST), Macau, China.

Macau University of Science and Technology

The Macau University of Science and Technology (MUST) is a leading higher education institution in Macau. The university campus offers modern conference facilities, providing an ideal environment for academic exchange and networking.

Address: Avenida Wai Long, Taipa, Macau, China

Conference Building: Block N, Faculty of Information Technology

Visit University Website

Transportation

By Ferry

Ferries connect Hong Kong and mainland China with Macau:

  • From Hong Kong: Ferries depart from the Hong Kong-Macau Ferry Terminal or China Ferry Terminal to either the Macau Outer Harbor Ferry Terminal or Taipa Ferry Terminal.
  • From mainland China: Ferries operate from various ports in Guangdong Province, including Shenzhen and Zhuhai, to Macau.

By Land

Macau is connected to mainland China via several border checkpoints:

  • From Zhuhai: Cross the Gongbei Border or the Hong Kong-Zhuhai-Macau Bridge. After crossing, taxis and public buses are available to reach the university.

Accommodation

Below are several hotels near the conference venue. Early booking is recommended as December is a busy season in Macau.

Grand Coloane Resort

Distance from venue: 3.5 km

Price range: $120-200 USD per night

A beachfront resort offering spacious rooms and extensive facilities.

Book Now

Galaxy Macau

Distance from venue: 2 km

Price range: $180-350 USD per night

An integrated resort offering luxury accommodations and entertainment options.

Book Now

Studio City Macau

Distance from venue: 1.5 km

Price range: $160-280 USD per night

A Hollywood-inspired integrated resort with modern amenities and entertainment.

Book Now

The conference organizers have negotiated special rates at select hotels. Please use the code "VRCAI2025" when booking to receive the discounted rate. More details will be provided closer to the conference date.

Local Attractions

Macau offers a unique blend of Chinese and Portuguese cultures, reflected in its architecture, cuisine, and traditions. We encourage attendees to explore the following attractions during their stay:

Ruins of St. Paul's

The most famous landmark in Macau, featuring the facade of the former Church of Mater Dei.

Senado Square

A vibrant public space with Portuguese-style buildings and mosaic-tiled pavement.

A-Ma Temple

One of the oldest temples in Macau, dedicated to the Chinese sea-goddess Mazu.
